-The FNIF supports a wide range of infrastructure projects on reserves, Crown land or land set aside for the use and benefit of First Nations. The FNIF targets infrastructure categories with long-standing community needs.
-Off-reserve projects can be considered if they are cost-shared with non-First Nations partners, such as nearby municipalities or other Indigenous partners.
-The FNIF was created as a complementary source of funding to the Capital Facilities and Maintenance Program and includes 9 categories of eligible infrastructure projects:
+The FNIF supports a wide range of infrastructure projects on reserves, Crown land or land set aside for the use and benefit of First Nations. The FNIF targets infrastructure categories with long-standing community needs.
+Off-reserve projects can be considered if they are cost-shared with non-First Nations partners, such as nearby municipalities or other Indigenous partners.
+The FNIF was created as a complementary source of funding to the
+Capital Facilities and Maintenance Program
+and includes 9 categories of eligible infrastructure projects:
-For more details, consult the First Nation Infrastructure Fund Program guide.
+For more details, consult the
+First Nation Infrastructure Fund Program guide
+.
-Projects are identified, reviewed and selected by Indigenous Services Canada (ISC), based on the First Nation Infrastructure Investment Plans.
-Contact your ISC regional office to learn more.
+Projects are identified, reviewed and selected by Indigenous Services Canada (ISC), based on the
+First Nation Infrastructure Investment Plans
+.
+Contact your
+ISC regional office
+to learn more.

-Professors
+Academic Supervisors
+$20k model: Can the 20K units be used for postdocs in Accelerate Entrepreneur, joint applications with NSERC or SSHRC, etc?
+Yes, $20k units will be available for all new postdoc submissions in Accelerate, including eAcc and joint applications.
-$20k model: Can we do 6-month units for $20k? Can the 20K units be used for postdocs in Accelerate Entrepreneur, joint applications with NSERC or SSHRC, etc?
-Yes, $20k units will be available for all new postdoc submissions in Accelerate, including eAcc and joint applications.
-$20k model: Can we do 6-month units for $20k? For the $20k postdoc option in Accelerate, can I still allocate $5k to research expenses?
+$20k model: For the $20k postdoc option in Accelerate, can I still allocate $5k to research expenses?
-$20k model: Can we do 6-month units for $20k? I am a postdoc currently on a $15k Accelerate, or I am a professor with a recently approved Accelerate project for a postdoc. Can I change to the $20k funding model
+$20k model: I am a postdoc currently on a $15k Accelerate, or I am a professor with a recently approved Accelerate project for a postdoc. Can I change to the $20k funding model?
-$20k model: Can we do 6-month units for $20k? I am a recent grad (post-PhD) but not a postdoc, can I access the $20k model?
+$20k model: I am a recent grad (post-PhD) but not a postdoc, can I access the $20k model?
-$20k model: Can we do 6-month units for $20k? If a postdoc is replaced with a PhD intern (or any other level), can they keep the $20k funding model?
+$20k model: If a postdoc is replaced with a PhD intern (or any other level), can they keep the $20k funding model?
-$20k model: Can we do 6-month units for $20k? Can postdocs still use the $15k model or are they required to use the $20k model?
+$20k model: Can postdocs still use the $15k model or are they required to use the $20k model?
